pr_title: Add logs and throw exceptions in getInstanceById

timeline.bodyText: This won't make things fail, will it? Since we are doing a continue, I don't think this would be necessary.
timeline.author: narendly

replies.bodyText: While this block doesn't fail the code, it's triggered in situations where idealState is null or is invalid. Just like the logs I did in InstanceServiceImpl.java, I think it's a good idea to log these unusual situations for debug purposes.
replies.author: NealSun96

replies.bodyText: This block mostly exists to filter out non-existing IdealStates and Task Framework idealStates. The reason I pointed this out is because I don't think it will add much in debugging and it will just end up making the log file large. Let's not log this.
replies.author: narendly

replies.bodyText:
I mostly want to ensure the case of idealState == null is caught. That situation shouldn't happen.
Regardless, I don't have a strong opinion about this.
replies.author: NealSun96

replies.bodyText: You're not catching anything here, right? Also if IdealState is null, you skip over that resource, right? Would that ever cause a problem?
